intro: Conyza pycnantha, commonly known as the common ironweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Africa, South America, and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features narrow, hairy leaves that are opposite along the stem. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white composite flowers arranged in dense, spherical clusters called heads. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides, fields, and waste areas. Conyza pycnantha is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil types.
